mark it up with markdown*

31 jan 2014

::: markdown info :::

Markdown is a way to write content for the web. It's written in what nerds like to call plaintext, which is exactly the sort of text we're used to writing and seeing.

Here is a link to a very helpful interactive tutorial regarding: markdown interactive tut

::: markdown cheatsheet :::

  • Emphasis
    • Emphasis, aka italics: *asterisks* or _underscores_
    • Strong emphasis, aka bold: **asterisks** or __underscores__
    • Combined emphasis with asterisks and underscores: **_asterisks_ and _underscores_**

  • Lists
    WYSIWYG plus spaces and blank lines

  • Links
    • inline link: [inline link](www.somesite.com)
    • reference link:
      [reference link]\[1]
      \n
      [1]: www.somesite.com
  • Images

    • inline image:
      ![an inline images alt text](http://image.URL.com/image-name.jpg)

    • reference image:
      ![a reference images alt text][2]
      \n
      [2]: http://image.URL.com/image-name.jpg
